questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: Why did the gorillas in Greenwood Forest initially prevent Chip from collecting fruits in their territory?
questions.Option1: a) Because Chip was too young
questions.Option2:
b)Because they wanted to teach Chip a lesson
c)
questions.Option3: c)Because they believed Chip was of a lower class
questions.Answer: c) Because they believed Chip was of a lower class

questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: What was the main message of King Lion when he addressed the gorillas about discrimination?
questions.Option1: a) Discrimination is acceptable under certain circumstances
questions.Option2: b) Discrimination should never be tolerated, and everyone should be treated fairly
questions.Option3: c) Discrimination should be left to the individual animals to decide
questions.Answer: b) Discrimination should never be tolerated, and everyone should be treated fairly

questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: Why is it important to stand up against discrimination, as demonstrated in the story?
questions.Option1: a) Because discrimination is sometimes necessary to maintain order.
questions.Option2: b) Because discrimination can lead to unity and understanding.
questions.Option3: c) Because discrimination is unfair and harms individuals and communities.
questions.Answer: c) Because discrimination is unfair and harms individuals and communities.

questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: In the end, what kind of forest did Greenwood become after everyone learned to stand up against discrimination?
questions.Option1: a) A divided and unhappy forest
questions.Option2: b) A forest where everyone shared its treasures and lived harmoniously
questions.Option3: c) A forest where only the gorillas had access to fruits
questions.Answer: b) A forest where everyone shared its treasures and lived harmoniously
